access: Help either the Washboard Dogs or the Diobel Sweepers destroy their rival.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs=""
>
[Coordinated Distraction](/Feats.aspx?ID=2210) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Agents of Edgewatch</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Rogue" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=139" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

**Access**
Help either the Washboard Dogs or the Diobel Sweepers destroy their rival.

</column>

---

With a sharp whistle or wave of your hands, you distract an opponent from the fact that one of your allies is about to attack them. Choose a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet. The target is [flat-footed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=16) against the first Strike the ally makes on their next turn; if your ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost. Depending on how you describe your distraction, this action gains either the [auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16) or [visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163) trait.

<title level="2">Gang Feats</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #159: All or Nothing](/Sources.aspx?ID=48) pg. 75</row>

Street gangs in Absalom recruit amateur pickpockets, ruffians, and vandals who show promise in their specialties and operate well in tight groups.

 Rogue agents can gain access to some of the following rogue feats by successfully helping Maurrisa Jonne or Bloody Berleth eliminate their rival (see Chapter 1). Some of these feats, however, can be gained only by helping a particular side in the gang conflict.

**Related Feats**: [Ambushing Knockdown](/Feats.aspx?ID=2207), [Deny Support](/Feats.aspx?ID=2209), [Slice and Swipe](/Feats.aspx?ID=2206), [Subtle Shank](/Feats.aspx?ID=2208)
name: Coordinated Distraction
